description: From Ancient Greek δεῖξις (deîxis, “pointing, indicating, reference”), from δείκνυμι (deíknumi, “I show”).

entries.meaning: (linguistics) The use of a word, such as a pronoun, to refer to something that must be identified from the wider context; a word used in such a way.
examples: Deixis allows for economy of speech but introduces ambiguity when that speech is recorded.
